alert.note: Alert for Greenlee (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 6:41PM MST until August 24 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River At Gila River at Duncan affecting Greenlee County. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River at Duncan...elevated river levels near minor flood stage is forecast to persist through this evening, then forecast to fall Wednesday, eventually falling below action stage Wednesday evening. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Gila River At Gila River at Duncan. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage: Highway 70 bridge approach bottom reached on left bank. Dike structure failure is a possibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM MST Tuesday the stage was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 11.4 feet early Sunday afternoon. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 800 PM MST.
